column2: NEBRASKA DMV TEST
Question Text
1. A red flashing signal means the same as a:
2. Signs and markings requiring that you obey the indicated instruction are known as _____ signs.
3. This sign means:
column6: The road will curve to the right.
column10: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.

column2: 4. Doing all you can to prevent crashes is called:
5. Give the right-of-way to any pedestrian:
column4: on the opposite side of the street.
column6: if you have the green light.

column2: 6. Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:
7. Which shape is a railroad advance warning sign?
8. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
9. A flashing red light means:
column4: Go, but yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column8: The light will soon change to steady red.
column10: The same as a STOP sign.

column2: 10. If the vehicle is equipped with air bags, seat belts:
11. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
12. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.
column6: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column8: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column10: Take your foot off the gas and shift to neutral.

column2: 13. When you make a left turn from a two-way road into a four-lane highway, you must:
column4: enter the right lane, to the left of the center line.
column6: go straight through the intersection, and then make the turn.
column8: enter the left lane, to the right of the center line.
column10: enter the right lane. When traffic permits, you can move out of the left lane.

column2: 14. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column6: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.
column8: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.
column10: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.

column2: 15. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column6: Schedule regular stops for every couple of hours.
column8: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.

column2: 16. Drivers are required by Nebraska's speed law to drive:
column6: 5 MPH below the posted speed limit.
column8: at a speed that is reasonable and safe under existing road and weather conditions.

column2: 17. This sign indicates:
18. Which shape is a yield sign?
19. When stopping on snow or ice, drivers who are operating vehicles equipped with ABS should:
column4: wait for the vehicle to stop without pressing on the brakes.
column6: pump the brakes until the vehicle comes to a complete stop.
column8: press the brake pedal firmly, do not pump brakes.

column2: 20. This road sign tells drivers that:
column6: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.
column8: they must turn either to the right or left.

column2: 21. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.
column6: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.
column8: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.

column2: 22. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column6: pull over to the right and stop until the road is clear.
column8: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.
column10: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.

column2: 23. Drivers should not sound their horn when:
24. This sign indicates:
25. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.
column8: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.
column10: increase their speed to cross the intersection before a train arrives.
